issue.title: The pop-up of version 1.85 (alpha) makes the game window move into the background

repository.name: SteamAchievementNotifier
repository.description: Steam Achievement Notifier shows fully customisable notifications when you unlock any achievement on Steam!

issue.body:
Hi hi,

I have a strange problem with the new alpha version of your still very good tool.

The pop-up of version 1.85 (alpha) makes the game window move into the background. Interaction is then only possible again when you click on the game with the mouse and bring it back to the foreground.

With the "old" version 1.84, I can not confirm the problem and is not present in my opinion there.
 However, I have only tested both versions with the game "Gylt".

Greetings

Plage

issue.title: feat: add `WebViewBuilder::with_focused`

repository.name: wry
repository.description: Cross-platform WebView library in Rust for Tauri.

body: @amrbashir I created the window by using `focused(false)`, and it behaves normally on Windows. Every time my message notification window appears, it does not automatically focus. However, `focused(false)` does not work on MacOS. Is this a problem with my usage?
it is unsupported on macOS, at least the webview portion of the window. I don't know much about macOS so can't help there.
Oh, that's it, thank you for your reply

Hello — I am also having some trouble with this. Does this mean that there are no plans to support `focus` in MacOS? I could help with the implementation (although I am not sure if I able to), but it could be that it is simply impossible on MacOS.

Encountering the same issue, on MacOS it doesn’t respect the `focus(false)`

and upon a new window getting launched, the **Main** window gets refocused!

any workarounds?
